summary: The Gestapo was Nazi Germany's secret police, created in 1933. It was led by Heinrich Himmler and was known for its cruelty. They targeted political enemies, religious groups, criminals, and especially Jews. People arrested by the Gestapo often disappeared without a trial. Though small, it was powerful due to public reporting. During World War II, they helped carry out the Holocaust. After the war, the Gestapo was labeled a criminal organization, and its leaders were punished.
title: Gestapo
